comment: Difficult class but you can do well if you actually try. Challenges you in all the right ways. Participation matters so you have to interact in class but you will never be judged or criticized. Super interesting class that made me proud to do well in.

I took his Chaucer SS, and it was tough. And yes, he did have strange due dates for his discussion posts. But, I couldn't imagine taking that course with a different professor. Dr. Palmer is funny, caring, and makes a naturally difficult class into an enjoyable experience. He's taught me a lot. He's a great professor and great professional friend.

Let me just say, Doctor Palmer is a good teacher who is incredibly passionate about his subject, but he places assignment deadlines erratically, beats in-class participation like a dead horse, assigns a huge amount of textbooks, and is unwavering. If you have any sort of responsibility or school/life balance (i.e. everyone), avoid at all costs.

Chris Palmer was so great, I loved his class and enjoyed his lectures. Medieval lit can sometimes be droning and dense, but he made it super interesting. He was incredibly helpful and provided great feedback for my mid term so I could make a higher grade on the final. You actually learn in his class, awesome professor.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Gives good feedback

comment: Dr. Palmer is one of my all time favorite professors! His classes are mandatory, but if you are present and active in class you will easily complete all the work. The final paper and the test are based off of things discussed in class, so being present is a huge help. Dr. Palmer is very available if you ever need help or advice on your work.

Dr. Palmer is very passionate about what he is teaching. He gives us a lot of creative liberty when it comes to assignments which was really nice. I enjoyed having him as a professor this semester, and I would take him again.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Amazing lectures

comment: Took him for senior seminar so a very hard class and subject, but he's really a great teacher. Very clear about what he wants and expects. Good at guiding us towards creating good content and truly a neat scholar to talk to. He's super nice and great to talk to, helped me develop my ideas for my capstone a LOT during our meetings outside of class.

Dr. Palmer has high expectations, but a contagious enthusiasm to match. The workload is one of the heaviest I've had so far, but he is also very fair. He wants students to succeed, and offers clear grading criteria, constructive feedback, and reasonable make-up opportunities. It's definitely not a class for slackers, but you can feasibly earn an A
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Palmer is amazing and LOVES class discussions. Speak up and you will do fine. If you don't talk, he takes points away from your grade. When you speak, you will not be judged and there is no wrong answer. He is always open for questions, even if it is something completely random. He is a great prof and very knowledgable. He is a super solid choice.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: I personally don't like British literature, but Dr. Palmer is so passionate, engaging, and knowledgeable that I really enjoyed the class. He keeps things fun and current, making even the most boring texts enjoyable. He never says your interpretation of the text is wrong, which is so important yet so hard to find in others. Great professor!

Dr. Palmer is AWESOME. He's really great and down to Earth, and he does his best to make sure his students pass. He's a really brilliant and funny guy and he's obviously very knowledgeable about linguistics, which is super admirable! You'll love his class for sure no matter WHAT your major is. Just make sure you READ and TAKE NOTES.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Dr. Palmer is one of the best professors I've ever had. He is brilliant, he challenges us to think, he knows how to walk students through processes, right up to the point where they understand on their own. I am a music major and only ended up in his class because I had to be full-time but ran out of classes so I added a minor. I'm so glad I did.

Palmer is so down-to-earth, non-biased, humble, kind, and smart that you won't even care about his pop quizzes or attendance policy. This is the type of classroom atmosphere that you're excited to be in. He really helped me peel back my eyes and see language and people in a different light. I am truly feeling enlightened after his class. Take him!

The ppl who seemed to struggle in here weren't taking advantage of the opportunities Dr. Palmer gave us. Every class you should definitely make a notecard if he gives that to you as an option and save your pop quizzes so you'll know what's on the announced quizzes. I found that once I stopped panicking I was able to understand the concepts better.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: Dr. Palmer is a tough professor, but you learn so much in his class. His tests are all short answer, but he does give half credit if you at least come close to answering thequestions. I have learned more from him than any other professor.

I currently have Dr. Palmer as a professor and I can truthfully say that he is very engaging, interesting, and genuinely cares about his students. Definitely makes you work for your grade in class, but is also willing to offer help if you need it. Very encouraging and passionate professor. Attend class!

I absolutely loved Dr. Palmer! He truly cared about all of us. His lectures are full of information and are also very entertaining. Participation is a big part of class, but it's really easy to chime in with your ideasopinions. Dr. Palmer respects all of his students and their ideas. I loved this class and hope to take another with Dr. Palmer!

Palmer was amazing. This was my first experience with linguistics, and I'm glad it was with him. The material isn't easy, but he makes sure that you receive all the tools that you need to make a good grade and really understand the info. Lets you have a cheat sheet on each test, which was a lifesaver. Definitely take him!

I took his intro to eng ling class and I absolutely loved it. It was a very interesting subject, but could be quite abstract at times. He did a great job of making things relatable and interesting. He has a sense of humor which is  wonderful in a professor. Helpful and willing to talk after class. I would definitely take another class with him.

Taking this class now.  Not an easy class, but if you attend, take notes, STUDY, and participate, you'll do fine.  Attendance isn't mandatory, but if you miss a day you miss a lot.  Class is very interesting and he's HILARIOUS, so you look forward to being there. He welcomes questions and sticks around after class. I'd take him again. A+ Instructor

He is such a great teacher. His class, Intro to Lang and Linguistics, was SUPER hard for me. But he tried really hard to help me. Somehow I ended up with a B even though I got D's on all the tests. His lectures are fun and he has a great attitude, and he is super hot too. Love Dr. Palmer!

I highly recommend this professor! he will help you should you not understand something.  His homework and quizzes are a small portion of the grade but it really helps you to prepare for exams. Take good notes and you'll be fine.  SUPER AWESOME TECHER!
Tough course content but very fair teacher whose interest and ability to work with students and give credit for trying really stands out.
he is an awesome professor, very passionate about the subjects he teaches.

I loved this class! Dr. Palmer is an excellent professor and KSU is lucky to have him. He is passionate about the subject matter, genuinely cares about his students, and really TEACHES. Plus, he's always willing to help if you need it. Not easy, but if you put forth the effort you will do well.

Palmer is my favorite teacher of all time. I had him for multiple classes and loved every one. He makes subjects that I usually find bland  quite interesting because he is so passionate about the subjects he teaches. He also cares about his students and takes time to help you if you need it. Best teacher ever. Take him!

Dr. Palmer is amazing! You can tell he really knows his material and he's super passionate about it. He expects you to be responsible for the material and actually learn something, so don't expect an easy A! He really wants you to engage with the material. Amazing professor! Take him!!

Linguistics is hard, and this is the first class that I've struggled in. That being said, however, Dr. Palmer is an amazing professor who is fully engaged and thoughtful. He expects a lot from you, but wants you to do well at the same time. Given the chance, I'd take him again in a heartbeat, despite his class being a challenge. Go to class!

Dr. Palmer is an awesome teacher and is very clear in class and on all his tests, assignments and expectations. The only thing is you have to be willing to speak up in class. Class discussions are a big part of your grade.

Dr. Palmer is amazing.  He is so helpful.  I talked to him one-on-one before our essays were due and he was always extremely helpful.  He is funny and smart.  Definitly wants everyone to participate in class. I never wanted to skip his class because he always kept things interesting. I've already signed up for a class with him next semester too!

I loved Dr. Palmer! KSU is so fortunate to have him! He's extremely witty, intellectual, but fun. This class was based on Politics & the English Language, and I loved the content and assigned readings (though numerous!). Participation is a big part of the course grade, which I think makes sense for every/any course you take in college.

Palmer is a pretty tough grader, but he is very clear when he tells you what he's looking for. His lecture style kept me awake, even though much of the material we covered was boring. He uses powerpoint, but does not post them online until just before the test, so you're forced to take notes in class.I'd definately take a class with him again.

Outstanding teacher!!  He gives 100 percent and he expects 100 percent from his students.  If you do the assignments, go to class, pay attention and take notes, you will learn and do well. I had him for Brit Lit and Linguistics and learned so much.  He is always there to help you in any way that he can.  Very encouraging!!!

Dr. Palmer was a fantastic professor. Very bright, funny managed to make very dry subject matter interesting because he was so engaging. Seems to genuinely care about his students and their ability to learn the subject matter. By no means an easy class but you will actually learn. Recommend him for any class.

Great teacher! This guy knows his stuff! You'll work hard, but he's funny and easy to understand. Take lots of notes! His quizzes and tests are hard, but you get a cheat sheet. There's a lot on info, but he's just so adorable you really don't mind taking it all in! Plus, he really cares about his students and whether or not you understand. A+ prof!
He's the BEST.
Excellent teacher. He will help you and challenge you to learn. The course is hard, but he makes it interesting and wants his students to do well. Always willing to go the extra mile to help.

Palmer is awesome. He's really smart, passionate about teaching, and wants you to learn. Just go to class and take notes! The material is not very difficult but you have to keep up with it and stay focused. Palmer is really cute and funny though so it's pretty easy to pay attention!

An asset to KSU! There are professors who really want to teach people, love their subject for the right reasons, and are not in it for themself. A quality teacher that forces people to learn and inspires people. He is not easy, but you will learn. He is effiecient and never makes you feel like you are wasting your time. He is a young Mr. Holland.
Great teacher for a hard class. He really knows his stuff and makes you care about it too because you can tell he loves it.

Dr. Palmer is an awesome teacher. The class (intro to language/linguistics) is tough but interesting. He cares about his students and as long as you put forth effort he will assist you. It's not so much that HE is hard, but the material that he teaches is difficult. This class is required for English and I absolutely recommend him.

he is approachable and will take the time to sit down one-on-one to make sure you understand the material. He gives a lot of tests, but if you do the reading and attend class you should be able to pass (start with the essay first). He is a little goofy, and he encourages a lot of class discussion. I definetly recommend taking his class.

Goofy guy. It was an interesting class, but tests are stressful. He lets you use a one-sided cheatsheet, which helps, but you still need to know your stuff. Expect to give VERY detailed answers on tests. He certainly knows a lot and expects a lot from his students, but he's not a tyrant. If you need help he's always open to talk about the course.
